relevant_findings.initial_examination: Well-appearing, afebrile infant. No murmurs, retractions, irregular breathing, or adventitial lung sounds.
relevant_findings.chest_radiograph: Right upper lobe infiltrate consistent with pneumonia.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient became lethargic and had a witnessed apneic episode with SpO2 decreasing to 80% on room air, improved with tactile stimulation.

relevant_findings.gastric_distention: Taut abdomen noted due to gastric insufflation.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After placement of supraglottic airway, SpO2 improved to 100% post-gastric decompression.
